message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.IT. 

The paper discusses the development of a simulator for evaluating the performance of Opportunistic Networking (OppNets) in the context of the Internet of Things (IoT). This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-category. Additionally, the paper deals with the operations of different protocol layers, which could fall under the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category. The use of new networking architectures for handling communications in the IoT could also place the paper in the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. The evaluation of performance could also be relevant to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category. Finally, the use of simulation techniques could place the paper in the Information Theory (cs.IT) sub-category.
